description: ERECTION OF BUILDING TO PROVIDE STORAGE WITH ANCILLARY OFFICE SPACE, INCORPORATING THE DEMOLITION OF EXISTING BUILDING
site_name: Building Used For Storage At Rear Of 121
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The developments to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Particulars and samples of the materials to be used on all external faces on the building, including fenestration, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works are commenced. Development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 3 - No structure including plant, water tanks, equipment or machinery shall be placed, erected or installed on or above the roof or on external walls without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The flat roofed areas hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden, sitting out area or for any other purpose of a similar nature without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work in pursuant of this permission shall be carried out on or before 08.00 hours or after 1800 hours on Mondays to Fridays inclusive, before 0800 hours or after 1300 hours on Saturdays and at no time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 6 - The garage and car parking spaces (and/or disabled/cycle parking spaces) as shown on the approved drawing 0111:11 shall be provided before commencement of the use of the land or buildings hereby permitted and thereafter shall be kept free from obstruction and shall not be used for purposes other than the parking of a vehicle in conjunction with the development hereby permitted.
Condition : 7 - The doors of the garage hereby approved shall not open out or encroach in any way onto the highway or shared accessway.

Condition : 8 - The car parking area hereby approved shall be surfaced in a material to be previously agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall be permanently marked out to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of the use of land or buildings hereby permitted and shall be permanently maintained thereafter.
